definitions.definition: to hold on tightly to somebody/something
definitions.sensetop: cling to somebody/somethingcling on to somebody/somethingcling oncling together

examples.text: Leaves still clung to the branches.
She clung on to her baby.
They clung together, shivering with cold.
I clung closely to my mother's arm.
The children clung together in fear.
houses clinging precariously to sheer cliffs
She clung tightly to her baby.
Survivors clung to pieces of floating debris.
The ground mist clung closely to the bushes.
a dress that clings *(= fits closely and shows the shape of your body)*
The wet shirt clung to his chest.
The smell of smoke still clung to her clothes.
Her hair clung to her hot damp skin.

definitions.definition: to stay close to somebody, especially because you need them emotionally

examples.text: After her mother's death, Sara clung to her aunt more than ever.

wordOrigin: Old English clingan ‘stick together’, of Germanic origin; related to Middle Dutch klingen ‘adhere’, Middle High German klingen ‘climb’, also to clench.
